stitch/whipped-back-stitch/ french knot tutorial https //sublimestitching com/pages/how-to-french-knot where indicated use the invisible fasten_off to ensure the edge is neat http //www stitch-story com/2010/12/invisible-fasten-off-one-of-my- favorite html you can use any yarn with this project however use a smaller hook than recommended to keep gauge tight project is approximately 4 5cm tall when made as directed with dk yarn and 3 0mm hook 3 cm tall if made with sport weight yarn and 2 0mm hook © akabekobotan 2024 body use light purple or light blue yarn part a foundation 6 st magic_ring st round 2 working into any stitch of the first piece *2dc in 1 st 2dc* repeat ** to end of round 24 st round 3 double_crochet around 24 st round 4 5dc *2dc in 1 st* 3 times 9dc *2dc in 1 st* 3 times in 1 st double_crochet 36 st round 11 *2dc in 1 st 5dc* repeat ** to end of round 42 st round 12 double_crochet around 42 st round 13 9dc invdec 6 times 9dc invdec 6 times 30 st round 14 9dc invdec 3 times 9dc invdec 3 times 24 st slip_stitch invisible fasten_off leaving a long tail for sewing up stuff with fibrefill align the long edges of round 14 together and using the yarn tail sew them together weave in yarn ends using black embroidery thread sew facial details onto the front as shown using whipped backstitch for the mouth and french knots for the eyes pokemon and all associated
